data.title: Meow Morse code
data.statement:
Let's start a Conspiracy Theory that cats are now talking:

Cleverly, they're using Morse Code as the base, and replacing the dashes and dots with {{Meow}}s and the shorter {{Mewl}}s, respectively.

Your task:
Convert this [[catTalk]] into its [[englishVersion]], to fully understand our feline friends.

A through Z in Morse Code is
.- -... -.-. -.. . ..-. --. .... .. .--- -.- .-.. -- -. --- .--. --.- .-. ... - ..- ...- .-- -..- -.-- --..

Words in Morse Code are separated by two spaces.


=== The rest is background re Morse Code and cats; it's <<NOT>> needed to solve this Clash ===
Sources, references and notes: 
• https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morse_code
• https://morsecode.world/international/translator.html
• https://www.lexilogos.com/keyboard/morse.htm
• http://www.catipsum.com/index.php
• The standard meow is mid-length in duration and mid-pitched in tone and is the “asking for something” sound. The mewl, a short high-pitched meow, usually means “hello,” and can be accompanied by rubbing against your legs.
• https://weareallaboutcats.com/5-common-cat-noises-and-what-they-mean/

testCases.title: Test 3 - thanks Kitty
testCases.testIn: MeowMewlMeowMeow MeowMeowMeow MewlMewlMeow  MewlMeow MewlMeowMewl Mewl  MeowMeow MeowMewlMeowMeow  MeowMeowMeow MewlMeowMeow MeowMewl Mewl MewlMeowMewl  MewlMewlMewl MeowMeowMeow  MewlMewlMewlMewl Mewl MewlMeowMewl Mewl  MewlMewl MewlMewlMewl  MewlMeow  MeowMewlMewl Mewl MewlMeow MeowMewlMewl  MeowMewlMewlMewl MewlMewl MewlMeowMewl MeowMewlMewl

testCases.testIn: MewlMeowMewlMewl MewlMeow MeowMeowMewlMewl MeowMewlMeowMeow  MewlMeow MeowMewl MeowMewlMewl  MeowMewlMeowMewl MewlMeowMewl MewlMeow MeowMeowMewlMewl MeowMewlMeowMeow

data.constraints: Everything in [[catTalk]] can be translated to an uppercase letter or a space.
data.stubGenerator:
read catTalk:string(1000)
write what your cat is saying

STATEMENT
A thru Z in Morse Code is
".- -... -.-. -.. . ..-. --. .... .. .--- -.- .-.. -- -. --- .--. --.- .-. ... - ..- ...- .-- -..- -.-- --.."

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Let's start a Conspiracy Theory that cats are now talking:

Cleverly, they're using Morse Code as the base, and replacing the dashes and dots with Meows and the shorter Mewls, respectively.

Your task:
Convert this catTalk into its englishVersion, to fully understand our feline friends.

A through Z in Morse Code is
.- -... -.-. -.. . ..-. --. .... .. .--- -.- .-.. -- -. --- .--. --.- .-. ... - ..- ...- .-- -..- -.-- --..

Words in Morse Code are separated by two spaces.


=== The rest is background re Morse Code and cats; it's NOT needed to solve this Clash ===
Sources, references and notes:
• https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morse_code
• https://morsecode.world/international/translator.html
• https://www.lexilogos.com/keyboard/morse.htm
• http://www.catipsum.com/index.php
• The standard meow is mid-length in duration and mid-pitched in tone and is the “asking for something” sound. The mewl, a short high-pitched meow, usually means “hello,” and can be accompanied by rubbing against your legs.
• https://weareallaboutcats.com/5-common-cat-noises-and-what-they-mean/
Input
Line 1: a string catTalk
Output
Line 1: a string englishVersion
Constraints
Everything in catTalk can be translated to an uppercase letter or a space.
Example
Input
Meow Mewl MewlMewlMewl Meow
Output
TEST
